definition: ruthless/fierce/ferocious/determined/to harden (one's heart)/old variant of 很[hen3]

sentences.english: When he said that, he was as fierce as a tiger.
sentences.chinese: 當他說話的時候，象一隻老虎那樣兇狠。

sentences.english: Everybody avoids the foreman. He acts like a Simon Legree.
sentences.chinese: 大家都避開那個工頭，他的行爲像個兇狠的老闆。

sentences.english: He read a few lines, and looked wrathfully at Berg.
sentences.chinese: 他念了幾行，便兇狠地瞟了貝格一眼。

sentences.english: Without love a person could go hayward and also become cruel and ferocious.
sentences.chinese: 沒有愛一個人會看破紅塵也會變得兇狠殘忍。

sentences.english: Carlos Boozer offered his interpretation of Sloan's demand for nastiness.
sentences.chinese: 布澤爾就斯隆提出的打的要更兇狠的要求給予了迴應。

sentences.english: Seeing the bee-man they went into action simultaneously stinging him fiercely and maliciously .
sentences.chinese: 它們看見了養蜂人，蜂擁而上，兇狠地蜇起他來。

sentences.english: He is a boy and a soldier, beautiful and fierce, honorable and angry.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個男孩，一名戰士，俊美而兇狠，可敬卻氣憤。

sentences.english: It had been a ferocious but perfectly legitimate tackle.
sentences.chinese: 這個剷斷很兇狠，但確實是合理的衝撞。

sentences.english: Cally didn't mind putting his foot in either, although he never got booked!
sentences.chinese: 卡里不會介意兇狠剷球，儘管他沒有拿過牌。

sentences.english: The two boxers glowered each other to squelch the other.
sentences.chinese: 兩位拳擊手兇狠地互相瞪着眼想以此鎮住對方。

sentences.english: He was as nervous as a witch and as cross as a bear .
sentences.chinese: 他象巫婆一樣神經過敏，像熊一樣橫蠻兇狠。

sentences.english: The fixity of eye in all the combatants upon the extremity of the street became ferocious.
sentences.chinese: 所有注視這街道盡頭的目光都變得兇狠異常。

sentences.english: It is brutal, murderous shelling of the Gaddafi regime.
sentences.chinese: 來自卡扎菲政權的瘋狂炮擊，真是殘暴兇狠。

sentences.english: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.
sentences.chinese: 腳步像蝴蝶一樣飄逸，出拳如蜂刺一般兇狠。

sentences.english: But like a hawk as fierce and violent hurricanes?
sentences.chinese: 而是像鷹一樣兇狠而殘暴的颶風？

definition: to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
